metadata.Title: Penman (Penman–Monteith evapotranspiration) strategy – EnergyBalance component
metadata.Authors: Peter D. Jamieson; Glen S. Francis; Derick R. Wilson; Robert J. Martin
metadata.Institution: New Zealand Institute for Crop and Food Research Ltd.
metadata.Extended description: This component implements the Penman–Monteith formulation to estimate daily evapotranspiration when wind/vapour pressure data are available, within the EnergyBalance suite. The algorithm combines a Priestly–Taylor radiative term with an aerodynamic term: ETp = ET_PT/Alpha + 1000 * (rhoAir * cpAir * VPDair * conductance) / (lambdaV * (hslope + psychrometricConstant)). Inputs are evapoTranspirationPriestlyTaylor (from Priestly–Taylor), hslope (slope of the saturation vapour pressure–temperature curve), VPDair (vapour pressure deficit), and boundary layer conductance. Parameters include psychrometricConstant (default 0.66), Alpha (1.5), lambdaV (2.454 MJ kg-1), rhoDensityAir (1.225 kg m-3), and specificHeatCapacityAir (0.00101 MJ kg-1 °C-1). Output is evapoTranspirationPenman in g m-2 d-1.
metadata.Short description: Penman–Monteith daily evapotranspiration estimator combining radiative (Priestly–Taylor) and aerodynamic terms.
